segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso mahāpathaviyā satta kolaṭṭhimattiyo guḷikā upanikkhipeyya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose a person was to place seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds on the great earth.

segments.pli: katamaṃ nu kho bahutaraṃ—yā vā satta kolaṭṭhimattiyo guḷikā upanikkhittā, ayaṃ vā mahāpathavī”ti?
segments.en: Which is more: the seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds, or the great earth?”

segments.pli: “Etadeva, bhante, bahutaraṃ, yadidaṃ—mahāpathavī; appamattikā satta kolaṭṭhimattiyo guḷikā upanikkhittā.
segments.en: “Sir, the great earth is certainly more. The seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds are tiny.

segments.pli: Saṅkhampi na upenti, upanidhampi na upenti, kalabhāgampi na upenti mahāpathaviṃ upanidhāya satta kolaṭṭhimattiyo guḷikā upanikkhittā”ti.
segments.en: Compared to the great earth, they can’t be reckoned or compared, they’re not even a fraction.”
“In the same way, for a noble disciple …
That’s why you should practice meditation …”

suttaplex.blurb: As a few jujube seeds compared to the great earth, so is the suffering remaining to one who has seen the four noble truths.
